title: Sony's New High-End Gaming Monitors Are $100 Off At Amazon
description: Sony released a pair of new gaming monitors in its high-end Inzone series last month, and now they are on sale for the first time during Black Friday. You can save $100 on the Inzone M10S OLED Gaming Monitor or the Inzone M9 II 4K Gaming Monitor.The M10S is designed as a premium, tournament-ready display--in fact, it was created in collaboration with esports team Fnatic to ensure it checked all the right boxes for professionals. The Inzone M9 II, meanwhile, is the successor to the M9 4K monitor that released in 2022. The Inzone series is primarily geared toward PC gaming, but the M9 and M9 II are great monitors for PlayStation 5, too.PC and PS5 gamers should also check out Amazon's Black Friday deals on the Sony Inzone Buds and Sony Inzone H9 Wireless Headset.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: SanDisk's New 2TB MicroSD Card Gets First Discount In Amazon's Black Friday Sale
description: Amazon has a bunch of stellar storage device deals for Black Friday, including steep discounts on high-capacity SanDisk microSD cards. Most notably, you can get the SanDisk Ultra 1.5TB microSD card for $89 (was $150). This is a great option for those looking to expand the storage capacity of their Steam Deck. Amazon also has its first-ever discount on the newly released SanDisk 2TB Extreme microSD card. And Nintendo Switch owners who love Pokemon enough to pay a slight premium for a microSD card with Snorlax's face on it can get a Black Friday discount on an officially licensed 1TB SanDisk microSD card.Quick look: Best Black Friday microSD Card DealsSanDisk Ultra 1.5TB microSD (150MB/s) -- $89 ($150)SanDisk Extreme 2TB microSD (190MB/s) -- $180 ($210)SanDisk Gameplay 1TB microSD (190MB/s) -- $90 ($125)SanDisk 1TB microSD - The Legend of Zelda Edition (100MB/s) -- $85 ($150)SanDisk 1TB microSD - Pokemon, Snorlax Edition (100MB/s) -- $90 ($150)Samsung Pro Plus 1TB microSD (180MB/s) -- $90 ($120)TeamGroup A2 Pro Plus 1TB microSD (160MB/s) -- $58 ($75)Lexar Play 1TB microSD (160MB/s) -- $66 ($130)Cards from other major brands, including Samsung, are also discounted for Black Friday. The high-end Samsung Pro Plus 1TB microSD is on sale for $90, and the 512GB model is only $40. For a budget-friendly high-capacity card, check out the Lexar Play 1TB for $66 or TeamGroup A2 Pro Plus for $60. SanDisk Ultra 1.5TB microSD Card $89 (was $150) The SanDisk Ultra works without a hitch on Steam Deck and Nintendo Switch, and it's also one of the most reliable and popular microSD cards around. It's graded for speeds of up to 150MB/s, which is faster than the officially licensed Nintendo microSDs by SanDisk and plenty fast enough for PC games installed to it on your Steam Deck. See at Amazon See at Best Buy SanDisk Extreme 2TB microSD Card $180 (was $210) Up until very recently, the 1.5TB card was the largest SanDisk offered, but now there's a 2TB SanDisk Extreme, and it's also on sale for Black Friday. Listed for $210, the SanDisk Extreme 2TB is discounted to $180 at Amazon. This is the first price cut for the newly released card. The Extreme offers up to 190MB/s transfer speeds.If you want the faster speeds but don't want to spend $180, the 1TB SanDisk Extreme is on sale for $80. See at Amazon See at Amazon (1TB) SanDisk Gameplay 1TB microSD Card for Handheld Gaming $90 (was $125) There's also the SanDisk Gameplay microSD, which was designed specifically for handheld gaming on Steam Deck, Nintendo Switch, and other devices. In terms of specs, the Gameplay is in the same class and offers the same 190MB/s speeds as the SanDisk Extreme. While we haven't compared performance between the two, we suspect they are identical. The SanDisk Gameplay does look snazzy, though. The 1TB model is on sale for $90 at Amazon for Black Friday. See at Amazon Pokemon-themed SanDisk 1TB microSD Card $90 (was $150) SanDisk has a range of officially licensed microSD cards imprinted with characters and emblems from popular Nintendo franchises. One of the newest additions to that lineup is this 1TB Pokemon-themed card, which appropriately features Snorlax.All of the Nintendo-themed cards carry higher prices than the regular SanDisk cards. You're saving over $50 off this card's launch price, but you're essentially paying the same price for 1TB as you would for 1.5TB. This card has a read speed of up to 100MB/s, so it's not as fast as the Ultra either. On Nintendo Switch this won't make a difference, but if for some reason you want a Pokemon-themed microSD for your Steam Deck, the drop in speed is worth keeping in mind. See at Amazon See at Best Buy Zelda-themed SanDisk 1TB microSD Card $85 (was $150) Amazon is also offering a big discount on the 1TB SanDisk card featuring the Royal Crest from The Legend of Zelda. In terms of performance, the Zelda-themed microSD card is identical to the Snorlax model, but it's on sale for only $85. See at Amazon Black Friday microSD Card Deals for Steam Deck & Nintendo SwitchWe rounded up all of the best early Black Friday microSD card deals below. Smaller capacity SanDisk cards are available for discounts as well, including the 512GB Ultra for $32. You can also save on Samsung's highly rated Pro Plus microSD cards, which offer read speeds of to 180MB/s. The 1TB Samsung Pro Plus is on sale for $90, while the 512GB is up for grabs for only $40.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Minerva: Metastasis is the best Half-Life game Valve never made
description: Half-Life 2 celebrated its 20th anniversary last week, with Valve releasing a hefty update to the original game alongside a two-hour documentary featuring interviews and a peek at never-before-seen footage and concept art from the game’s development.  As a longtime fan of the series who considers Half-Life 2 one of my most formative experiences playing […]

title: A Wicked problem: when your actor and VFX both rely on green
description: In Wicked, wicked-witch-to-be Elphaba (Cynthia Erivo) is ostracized by her fellow Ozians because of her green skin and her magical powers. But on the set of a big-budget Hollywood studio production that leans heavily on visual effects instead of magic, she has her own viridescent foe: green-screen technology. Vivid green backdrops — often referred to as “chroma […]

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 857
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Butter on your toast – yes or no? Yes please! And if it’s Kerrygold Salted Butter, then woo hoo. 2. Your two favorite seasons? Fall and spring. 3. Pick your red lipstick for the day – what’s the name? Rouge Dior 999. 4. A Thanksgiving dish you don’t like? Soggy gray green bean casserole. 5. A color that makes you happy? Yellow (hence the picture of the butter at the top, ha). Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen P.S. Here are the questions to copy/paste with your answers in a comment. Talk to ya soon. 1. Butter on your toast – yes or no? 2. Your two favorite seasons? 3. Pick your red lipstick for the day – what’s the name? 4. A Thanksgiving dish you don’t[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 857 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 838
description: Don’t let the torbitude and dreamy eyes fool ya. Rosie is a ruthless competitor. She knows what she wants, and she usually gets it. Take, for instance, last summer’s crisis over her favorite treats, the aptly named Temptations, in tasty chicken flavor. She wanted more of them than I could provide. To be honest, she wanted them all — all of the Tasty Chicken Temptations nationwide. She threw herself into research, trying to reverse engineer the recipe for Temptations; however, every batch was a little bit off. Growing frustrated, she encountered an old sailor cat in a downtown Novato bar who told her the story of El Río de Tentación, the River of Temptation… According to the legend, hidden somewhere along the banks of the Sacramento River in Northern California were ancient ruins, within which held the Lost Book of Temptation, the book that contained the original recipe for Tasty Chicken Temptations. Rosie set out to find it! After three days of searching, during which time she became very hungry, she found the ruins…. The[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 838 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
